Definition.WordDefinition: ADAGE, n. Boned wisdom for weak teeth.

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Adage \Ad"age\, n. [F. adage, fr. L. adagium; ad + the root of L. aio I say.] An old saying, which has obtained credit by long use; a proverb. [1913 Webster]
Letting ``I dare not'' wait upon ``I would,'' Like the poor cat i' the adage. --Shak. [1913 Webster]
Syn: Axiom; maxim; aphorism; proverb; saying; saw; apothegm. See {Axiom}. [1913 Webster]
adage n : a condensed but memorable saying embodying some important fact of experience that is taken as true by many people [syn: {proverb}, {saw}, {byword}]
